page.title: 18SUTTON MILL
page.content: One of the most important features of the village is Sutton Mill. This was a corn mill which was built in 1789 and ceased operating in 1940 after being struck by lightning. It was bought a few years ago by Mr Nunn. With his family he is carefully restoring it. He hopes to have the mill fully operational again. This year he fitted a new cap and stocks. The mill is the tallest in the country and can be seen from miles around. It is open to the public during the summer. The view from the top is impressive. Several village churches and the coastal dunes are visible. On a clear day Yarmouth can be seen. Mr Nunn has also opened a small museum at the foot of the mill. The mill is popular with local school children and visitors to Broadland.
